summary: This document is an email chain from November 2020 between prosecutors in the United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell case and the office of Dr. Cooper, a potential expert witness. The prosecutors are seeking to schedule a call with Dr. Cooper to discuss her potentially testifying at trial about concepts relating to child victims of sexual abuse.

persons.name: Jan Johnson
persons.context: Coordinates scheduling and communication for Dr. Cooper's office, Developmental & Forensic Pediatrics, P.A., in relation to a potential expert witness call with prosecutors.

persons.name: Dr. Cooper
persons.context: A medical professional with expertise in developmental and forensic pediatrics, specifically regarding child victims of sexual abuse, whom prosecutors wish to consult for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell' referenced by the prosecutors as the subject of the trial for which an expert witness is sought.

connections.description: Jan Johnson acts as the legal and conference coordinator for Dr. Cooper's practice, facilitating her schedule and communications.
The prosecutors are seeking to engage Dr. Cooper as a potential expert witness to testify in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

events.title: Scheduled Expert Witness Call
events.description: A conference call is scheduled between Dr. Cooper and the prosecutors to discuss her potential testimony.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: The trial for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell is stated to be scheduled for this date in the Southern District of New York.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors in the Ghislaine Maxwell case were seeking an expert witness in late 2020 to testify about child victims of sexual abuse.
The expert, Dr. Cooper, is associated with Developmental & Forensic Pediatrics, P.A.
The prosecutors clarified they were not seeking an opinion on specific case facts, but rather an explanation of general terms and concepts.
The trial for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell was, at the time of this correspondence, scheduled for July 12, 2021.
The communication shows the prosecution's preparation phase, specifically in lining up expert testimony well ahead of the trial date.
